newsitem.title: INDIA: India UTI Securities, Nomura talks continue.
newsitem.headline: India UTI Securities, Nomura talks continue.

text.p: India's UTI Securities and Japan's Nomura Securities have not yet reached agreement but are continuing their talks for a strategic alliance, sources close to the negotiations said on Thursday.
"Some discussions are going on," the source told Reuters. "We have not reached the stage of finalising a deal."
The Economic Times newspaper said on Thursday that UTI Securities was close to giving Nomura Securities a 40 percent equity holding in the stockbroking firm.
The source said the quantum of divestment has not been decided.
"It can be 26 percent... or more, but it's premature at the moment," he said. "Nothing is concrete."
The source said discussions between the two firms have been going on for several months.
UTI Securities is the broking arm of Unit Trust of India, the country's largest investment firm.
